member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CancellationTokenExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for to allow

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CancellationTokenExtensions.UnsafeRegister(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Action{System.Object},System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a delegate that will be called when this CancellationToken is canceled.

remarks.para: If this token is already in the canceled state, the delegate will be run immediately and synchronously. Any exception the delegate generates will be propagated out of this method call.
ExecutionContext is not captured nor flowed to the callback's invocation.

member.param: The CancellationToken to register the callback with.
The delegate to be executed when the CancellationToken is canceled.
The state to pass to the when the delegate is invoked. This may be null.
member.returns: The instance that can be used to unregister the callback.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler
member.summary: Provides a handler used by the language compiler to process interpolated strings into instances.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.GuessedLengthPerHole
member.summary: Expected average length of formatted data used for an individual interpolation expression result.
member.remarks: This is inherited from string.Format, and could be changed based on further data. string.Format actually uses `format.Length + args.Length * 8`, but format.Length includes the format items themselves, e.g. "{0}", and since it's rare to have double-digit numbers of items, we bump the 8 up to 11 to account for the three extra characters in "{d}", since the compiler-provided base length won't include the equivalent character count.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.MinimumArrayPoolLength
member.summary: Minimum size array to rent from the pool.
member.remarks: Same as stack-allocation size used today by string.Format.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._provider
member.summary: Optional provider to pass to IFormattable.ToString or ISpanFormattable.TryFormat calls.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._arrayToReturnToPool
member.summary: Array rented from the array pool and used to back .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._chars
member.summary: The span to write into.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._pos
member.summary: Position at which to write the next character.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler._hasCustomFormatter
member.summary: Whether provides an ICustomFormatter.
member.remarks: Custom formatters are very rare. We want to support them, but it's ok if we make them more expensive in order to make them as pay-for-play as possible. So, we avoid adding another reference type field to reduce the size of the handler and to reduce required zero'ing, by only storing whether the provider provides a formatter, rather than actually storing the formatter. This in turn means, if there is a formatter, we pay for the extra interface call on each AppendFormatted that needs it.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a handler used to translate an interpolated string into a .
member.param: The number of constant characters outside of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
The number of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
member.remarks: This is intended to be called only by compiler-generated code. Arguments are not validated as they'd otherwise be for members intended to be used directly.

member.remarks: This is intended to be called only by compiler-generated code. Arguments are not validated as they'd otherwise be for members intended to be used directly.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IFormatProvider,System.Span{System.Char})
member.summary: Creates a handler used to translate an interpolated string into a .
member.param: The number of constant characters outside of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
The number of interpolation expressions in the interpolated string.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
A buffer temporarily transferred to the handler for use as part of its formatting. Contents may be overwritten.
member.remarks: This is intended to be called only by compiler-generated code. Arguments are not validated as they'd otherwise be for members intended to be used directly.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.ToString
member.summary: Gets the built .

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.ToStringAndClear
member.summary: Gets the built and clears the handler.
member.remarks: This releases any resources used by the handler. The method should be invoked only once and as the last thing performed on the handler. Subsequent use is erroneous, ill-defined, and may destabilize the process, as may using any other copies of the handler after is called on any one of them.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DefaultInterpolatedStringHandler.Clear
member.summary: Clears the handler.
member.remarks: This releases any resources used by the handler. The method should be invoked only once and as the last thing performed on the handler. Subsequent use is erroneous, ill-defined, and may destabilize the process, as may using any other copies of the handler after is called on any one of them.

member.name: T:System.ISpanFormattable
member.summary: Provides functionality to format the string representation of an object into a span.

member.name: M:System.ISpanFormattable.TryFormat(System.Span{System.Char},System.Int32@,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Tries to format the value of the current instance into the provided span of characters.
member.param: When this method returns, this instance's value formatted as a span of characters.
When this method returns, the number of characters that were written in .
A span containing the characters that represent a standard or custom format string that defines the acceptable format for .
An optional object that supplies culture-specific formatting information for .
member.returns: if the formatting was successful; otherwise, .
member.remarks: An implementation of this interface should produce the same string of characters as an implementation of on the same type. TryFormat should return false only if there is not enough space in the destination buffer. Any other failures should throw an exception.
